Package org.loudouncodes.combinatorics

Class PowerSet

java.lang.Object
org.loudouncodes.combinatorics.PowerSet
All Implemented Interfaces:
Iterable<int[]>
public final class PowerSet extends Object implements Iterable<int[]>
PowerSet â€” all subsets of {0,1,...,n-1}.

Default order is size-then-lexicographic: k = 0, 1, ..., n; for each k, emit all k-combinations in lexicographic order.

Examples


 // n = 3 emits (in size-then-lex order):
 // []            (k=0)
 // [0] [1] [2]   (k=1)
 // [0,1] [0,2] [1,2]  (k=2)
 // [0,1,2]       (k=3)
 for (int[] subset : PowerSet.of(3)) {
   // use subset
 }

Guarantees

  • Immutable spec; lazy iteration.
  • Deterministic order (size-then-lex).
  • Defensive copies: each returned int[] is a fresh snapshot.
  • Iterator contract: hasNext() / next() consistent; exhaustion throws NoSuchElementException.
  • Argument validation: n >= 0, else IllegalArgumentException.

      public BigInteger count()
      Total number of subsets.
      Returns:
      2^n as a BigInteger

    • size

      public long size()
      Convenience alias for count() returning a best-effort long.

      If 2^n does not fit in a signed 64-bit value, returns Long.MAX_VALUE.

      Returns:
      approximate count as a long (saturates at Long.MAX_VALUE if overflow)
